sections.title: Which AEO status is your business applying for?

fields.label: Which AEO status is your business applying for?
optionHelpText: Your business must be able to show it has staff with the experience or qualifications to deal with customs activities
Your business must  be able to show it has security standards in place for its customs activities
Your business must also be able to show it has both experienced or qualified staff, and security standards in place for its customs activities

fields.infoText:
You need to complete all of the forms on this page.  
  
We save your progress for **28 days**, starting from when you select the first link.  
  
When you are ready, you must submit all forms at the same time.

fields.label: infoAdvice
fields.infoText:
To help complete everything in time:  
- make sure you have your EORI number to hand for every form
- you can start and save any form in any order
- authorised people in your business can work on different forms at the same time, using the same Government Gateway ID and password
##Forms you need to complete

[C117](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C117-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator/nonagent?gac=cd886458-7579-4be7-a5de-afc163d8a564) - Business and customs addresses, activity and audited accounts, and responsible people

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C117
fields.infoText:
**Detail about the business**, including:
- all business addresses, including where you keep customs identification and documentation
- legal registration number
- VAT registered number
- any group your business is part of, including if theyâ€™ve applied for AEO authorisation

**Detail about the people**, including:
- name, address and email of person responsible for customs matters
- name, position, telephone number and email of designated contact person
- name, address, position, date of birth and National Insurance number for person in charge of company or control of management contact

**Detail about the business activity**, including:
- EU member states, ports and customs offices you use to import, export, or transit goods
- simplifications or facilitations your business has, with the type, code and authorisation numbers
- any certificates it holds mentioned in article 28 of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/2447
- upload audited accounts for last 3 years of trading - PDF or JPEG (5MB maximum)

[C118-1-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-1/nonagent?gac=da44af2b-c98b-48c0-b3c2-1ae6a3882cb9) - Internal structure, business ownership and management, and third party locations

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-1-1
fields.infoText:
**Business information details**, including:


- any AEO authorisation or current audits of other companies in your group

- if your company was established in the last 3 years from internal reorganisation

- who is in charge of your business, or has control over the management

- names of your senior management, and their roles

- who your shareholders, directors and managers are, including how many shares they own:
  - for UK nationals, their name and National Insurance number
  - for non-UK nationals, their name, date of birth and residential address
  

- who is responsible for customs matters, their name and National Insurance number, and place of birth if non-UK national

- company locations, including employee numbers and business activity

- any third party locations where outsourced work takes place

- internal organisation structure and responsibilities of each department

[C118-1-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-2/nonagent?gac=7488a7c4-3c1f-4e45-adfd-1c4dfcd6926f) - Volume of business, annual turnover and accounts, declarations estimates, duty and VAT

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-1-2
fields.infoText:
**Volume of business details**, including:

* annual turnover figures for the last 3 sets of completed annual accounts
* annual net profit or loss figure for the last 3 sets of completed annual accounts
* any storage facilities you use which are owned by others
* estimates for each of the last 3 years of:  
   *  number and value of import declarations  
    * number and value of import/re-export declarations  
     * number and value of the special procedures declarations  
     * customs duty paid  
     * excise amount paid  
    * import VAT paid




* any changes you foresee in the next 2 years to:
   * structure
    * supply chain

[C118-1-3](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-3/nonagent?gac=2708a0a5-2740-464a-afb2-cd9eeb0c0e8b) - Customs formalities, tariff classifications, value and certification, plus anti-dumping or countervailing duties

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-1-3
fields.infoText:
**Business customs matters details**, including:

- who performs customs formalities, including EORI
- if you represent anyone else for customs formalities, and who these clients are
- how you decide tariff classification of goods, who does this, and how you make sure these are correct
- how you decide customs value, and make sure this is correct
- any overview of preferential or non-preferential origin of imported goods
- how you verify the country of origin for goods
- how you issue proof of preferences and certificates for origin for exportation
- any goods subject to anti-dumping or countervailing duties, plus details of manufacturers or countries outside EU whose goods are subject to these duties

[C118-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-2/nonagent?gac=73a97f5d-8fe0-4ba7-b6b8-25f7767077f9) - Compliance record, convictions and customs authorisation

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-2
fields.infoText:
**Compliance record, convictions and customs authorisation details**, including:





- any breaches of customs and taxation rules in the last 3 years

- how you notified government authorities of breaches

- what measures you brought in to avoid these in future

- any convictions and sentencing for serious infringement of criminal laws relating to economic activity

- any other customs authorisation youâ€™ve applied for, or plan to apply for

- any applications turned down, or existing authorisations suspended or revoked, due to breaches of customs rules in last 3 years

[C118-3-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-3-part-1/nonagent?gac=af5eb146-e193-42dd-a2ab-5ea9460aaaa0) - Audit trail, internal control system, flow of goods, stocktaking checks, recent customs routes audit report

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-3-1
fields.infoText:
**Audit trail, internal control system, and flow of goods details**, including:



- how your accounting system allows an audit trail of customs activities and tax

- what computer system you use for business and for customs matters

- how your computer system is integrated, and what separation of functions there is

- who has access to the system

- what traceability there is between business and declaration systems 

- how systems distinguish between EU and non-EU goods, and show the location

- where computer activities take place, and if theyâ€™re outsourced

- what in-house guidelines exist for internal control system in the accounts department, buying department, sales department, customs department, production, material and merchandise management and logistics

- how you check computer files and avoid incorrect information

- how your registration procedure tracks and records the flow of goods

- how you handle checks and discrepancies for stocktaking and inventory

- upload any recent internal control system audit report - PDF or JPEG (5MB maximum)

[C118-3-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-3-part-2/nonagent?gac=524cd6be-7f7d-41ec-907d-0990b00aba16) -  Customs routines, computer system back-up and protection, security documentation and compliance

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-3-2
fields.infoText:
**Customs routines, back-up and protection of computer systems, and security documentation details**, including:





- how you document checking customs declaration accuracy

- how you document irregularities and notify authorities, and if you've done this in the last year

- how you deal with economic trade licences for goods, including goods subject to prohibitions and restrictions

- how you implement and update Internal Compliance Programme procedures

- how you deal with business records, including archiving and retrieval  
  
- security of the main server, including testing, protection systems, unauthorised access and system failure
  
- who runs the computer systems

- who has access to computer systems and how this is monitored, plus how you protect documentation

- what security requirements you have for trade partners using your information, and for employees accessing detailed data on flow of materials and goods

[C118-4](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-4/nonagent?gac=c9b9dba2-065d-43f1-b46f-4bb6800c5de2) - Financial solvency and standing, Duty Deferment accounts, approved cash flow, balance sheet and profit/loss forecasts

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-4
fields.infoText:
**Financial solvency details**, including:





- any bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings for your companyâ€™s assets in the last 3 years

- whether your business has had good financial standing over the last 3 years, including details if it has not met financial commitments

- if established in last 3 years, provide latest cash flow, balance sheet and profit and loss forecasts approved by directors, partners or sole proprietor - upload in PDF or JPEG (5MB maximum)

- anything which could impact on solvency in the foreseeable future

- any Duty Deferment Account and DAN number

[C118-5](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-5/nonagent?gac=25cfca8b-5f70-4227-9903-618cf66ada0f) - Customs competence expert, their professional qualifications, training and European Standardisation compliance

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-5
fields.infoText:
**Person in charge of customs competence and professional qualifications details**, including:





- demonstration of 3 years of practical experience

- how they comply with a European Standardisation quality standard 

- where they got their qualifications, plus any other training from the customs authority of an EU member state, recognised educational establishment, or professional or trade association
